page.title: 12Ackers Leisure Park B'ham
page.content: The Ackers Leisure Park lies on 19 hectares of former wasteland south of the Small Heath Bypass. It originated in 1977 as a reclamation scheme by Oldknow School and in 1981 The Ackers Trust was registered as a charity. Finance for the clearance of rubble and planting of thousands of trees has come from West Midlands Council. The park is crossed by the InterCity rail line and Grand Union Canal as well as the River Cole. Improvements already made include the National Motorcycle Circuit, a manmade ski slope and a renovated canal basin. The high point is the artificially built Ackers Hill- 125m which gives a fine view of the area. Future plans include boating, climbing, picnicking and riding facilities as well as a riverside walk between Warwick and Coventry roads, a direct link to the Railway Museum.
